com.mapbox.services.android.navigation.v5

Class MapboxNavigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapbox.services.android.navigation.v5.MapboxNavigation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MilestoneEventListener

    public class MapboxNavigation
extends Object
implements MilestoneEventListener
    This is an experimental API. Experimental APIs are quickly evolving and might change or be removed in minor versions.
    Since:
    0.1.0

        public void onStart()
        It's required to include both the onStop and onStart inside your navigation activities identically named lifecycle methods.
        Since:

      • addMilestone

        public void addMilestone(Milestone milestone)

      • setLocationEngine

        public void setLocationEngine(com.mapbox.services.android.telemetry.location.LocationEngine locationEngine)
        Before starting a navigationService, it is required to setup a LocationEngine and pass it into your instance of MapboxNavigation. If a locationEngine isn't provided, one will be created.
        Parameters:
        locationEngine - A LocationEngine used for the navigation session.

      • addMilestoneEventListener

        public void addMilestoneEventListener(MilestoneEventListener milestoneEventListener)

      • removeMilestoneEventListener

        public void removeMilestoneEventListener(MilestoneEventListener milestoneEventListeners)

      • addNavigationEventListener

        public void addNavigationEventListener(NavigationEventListener navigationEventListener)
        Optionally listen into when a new navigation event occurs. This listener can be used to listen into when the navigation service is running in the background or not.
        Parameters:
        navigationEventListener - a new NavigationEventListener which will be notified when navigation events occur.
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • removeNavigationEventListener

        public void removeNavigationEventListener(NavigationEventListener navigationEventListener)

      • addProgressChangeListener

        public void addProgressChangeListener(ProgressChangeListener progressChangeListener)
        Optionally, setup a progress change listener to be notified each time the users location has changed. For more details see ProgressChangeListener.
        Parameters:
        progressChangeListener - a new ProgressChangeListener which will be notified when event occurs.
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • removeProgressChangeListener

        public void removeProgressChangeListener(ProgressChangeListener progressChangeListener)

      • addOffRouteListener

        public void addOffRouteListener(OffRouteListener offRouteListener)

      • removeOffRouteListener

        public void removeOffRouteListener(OffRouteListener offRouteListener)

      • setSnapToRoute

        public void setSnapToRoute(boolean snapToRoute)
        Disable or enable the snap to route for navigation, by default this is set to enable. When enabled, the snap to route functionality of this SDK takes place and the user will snap to the route if the user is currently along the route giving a better user experience. It's recommend to leave this enabled. Otherwise, the location used for Navigation will be the actual GPS location which will typically be noisy and not follow the route.
        Parameters:
        snapToRoute - boolean true if you'd like snap to route be enabled, else false; defaults true.
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • startNavigation

        public void startNavigation(com.mapbox.services.api.directions.v5.models.DirectionsRoute route)
        Call startNavigation passing in a DirectionsRoute object to begin a navigation session. It is recommend to call getRoute(Position, Position, Callback) before starting a navigation session.
        Parameters:
        route - A DirectionsRoute that makes up the path your user will traverse along.
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • updateRoute

        public void updateRoute(com.mapbox.services.api.directions.v5.models.DirectionsRoute directionsRoute)
        When a reroute's performed, use this API to pass in the new directions route.
        Parameters:
        directionsRoute - the new DirectionsRoute
        Since:
        0.3.0

      • endNavigation

        public void endNavigation()
        Call this method to end a navigation session before the user reaches their destination. There isn't a need to call this once the user reaches their destination.
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • setupNotification

        public void setupNotification(android.app.Activity activity)
        Parameters:
        activity - The activity being used for the navigation session.
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • getRoute

        public void getRoute(@NonNull
                     com.mapbox.services.commons.models.Position origin,
                     @NonNull
                     com.mapbox.services.commons.models.Position destination,
                     @Nullable
                     Float userBearing,
                     retrofit2.Callback<com.mapbox.services.api.directions.v5.models.DirectionsResponse> callback)
        Request navigation to acquire a route and notify your callback when a response comes in. A NavigationException will be thrown if you haven't set your access token, origin or destination before calling getRoute. It's advised to pass in the users bearing whenever possible for a more accurate directions route.

        If you'd like navigation to reroute when the user goes off-route, call this method with the updated information.

        Parameters:
        callback - A callback of type DirectionsResponse which allows you to handle the Directions API response.
        origin - the starting position for the navigation session
        userBearing - provide the users bearing to continue the route in the users direction
        destination - the arrival position for the navigation session
        Since:
        0.3.0

      • getRoute

        public void getRoute(@NonNull
                     com.mapbox.services.commons.models.Position origin,
                     @NonNull
                     com.mapbox.services.commons.models.Position destination,
                     retrofit2.Callback<com.mapbox.services.api.directions.v5.models.DirectionsResponse> callback)
        Request navigation to acquire a route and notify your callback when a response comes in. A NavigationException will be thrown if you haven't set your access token, origin or destination before calling getRoute. It's advised to pass in the users bearing whenever possible for a more accurate directions route.

        If you'd like navigation to reroute when the user goes off-route, call this method with the updated information.

        Parameters:
        callback - A callback of type DirectionsResponse which allows you to handle the Directions API response.
        origin - the starting position for the navigation session
        destination - the arrival position for the navigation session
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • getRoute

        public void getRoute(@NonNull
                     List<com.mapbox.services.commons.models.Position> coordinates,
                     @Nullable
                     Float userBearing,
                     retrofit2.Callback<com.mapbox.services.api.directions.v5.models.DirectionsResponse> callback)
              throws NavigationException
        Request navigation to acquire a route and notify your callback when a response comes in. A NavigationException will be thrown if you haven't set your access token, origin or destination before calling getRoute.
        Parameters:
        callback - A callback of type DirectionsResponse which allows you to handle the Directions API response.
        coordinates - list of Position which you'd like to have your route traverse to
        userBearing - provide the users bearing to continue the route in the users direction
        Throws:
        NavigationException
        Since:
        0.4.0

      • getOrigin

        public com.mapbox.services.commons.models.Position getOrigin()
        Get the current origin Position that will be used for the beginning of the route. If no origin's provided, null will be returned. An origin can be set using the getRoute(Position, Position, Callback) method.
        Returns:
        A Position object representing the origin of your route.
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • getDestination

        public com.mapbox.services.commons.models.Position getDestination()
        Get the current destination Position that will be used for the end of the route. If no destinations's provided, null will be returned. A destination can be set using the getRoute(Position, Position, Callback) method.
        Returns:
        A Position object representing the destination of your route.
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • setUserOriginBearing

        public void setUserOriginBearing(float userBearing)
        Optional but recommended parameter that can be used to route a user in the correct orientation they are already headed in. This will help prevent routing the user to begin the route by performing an illegal U-turn.
        Parameters:
        userBearing - int between 0 and 260 representing the users current bearing.
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • getUserOriginBearing

        public float getUserOriginBearing()
        Gets the current user bearing that will be used when getRoute(Position, Position, Callback)'s called. If no value's set, the return value will be null.
        Returns:
        A value between 0 and 360 or null if the userOriginBearing hasn't been set.
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • getMapboxNavigationOptions

        public MapboxNavigationOptions getMapboxNavigationOptions()
        Get the currently used MapboxNavigationOptions, if one isn't set, the default values will be used.
        Returns:
        the set MapboxNavigationOptions object
        Since:
        0.3.0
